div.p: A WOMAN forbidden to ſpeak IN the Church, The grounds examined, the Myſtery opened, the Truth cleared, and the ignorance both of Prieſts and Peeple diſcovered.
Written by a friend of the Truth, whoſe name in the fleſh is RICHARD FARNEWORTH.

q.p: And Jeſus unſwering, ſayd unto them, Do ye not therefore erre, becauſe ye know not the Scripture, neither the power of God,

For as many of you as have been baptized into Chriſt, have put on Christ: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither bond nor free, there is neither male nor female, for ye are all one in Chriſt Ieſus,
Ieſus anſwered and ſayd, My Doctrin is not mine but his that ſent me: If any man will do his Will, he ſhall know of the doctrin whether it be of God, or whether I ſpeak of my ſelf,

div.p: LONDON, Printed for Giles Calvert at the Black Spread Eagle, at the Weſt End of Pauls. 1654.

div.head: A Woman forbidden to ſpeak in the CHURCH.
The Grounds examined, the Myſtery opened, the Truth cleared, and the Ignorance both of Prieſts and People diſcovered.

q.p: But the Spirit of Truth may declare through the Temple, and dwell in it, which the world cannot receive,

div.p:
THe Church is in God the Father of our Lord Jeſus Christ, as Paul and Silvanus writ to the Theſſalonians, 1 Theſſ. 1.1. and it is made all of living ſtones, elect and precious, 1 Pet. 2 5. and the Saints: their Bodyes are made fit Temples for the Holy Ghoſt to dwell in, 2 Cor. 6.16. and they are made a fit Habitation for God through the Spirit, being builded upon the Foundations of the Prophets and the Apoſtles of the Lord Ieſus, in whom all the Building fitly framed groweth unto an holy Temple in the Lord, Epheſ. 2.20, 21, 22. and in this Church all are taught of God, as it is written in the Prophets, Iſai 54.13, 14. & Ier. 31.33, 34. and like wiſe in Heb. 8.10, 14. and ſayth Ieſus Christ in Iohn 14. I will pray the Father, and he ſhall give you mother Comforter, that he may abide with you for ever, even the Spitit of Truth, whom the World cannot receive, becauſe it ſeeth him not, neither knoweth him, but ye know him for he dwelleth with you, and ſhall be in you, Verſ. 16, 17. Now nothing is to ſpeak in this Church which is ſpiritual, but that which i • ſpiritual, even the Holy Ghoſt, which is inviſible
and incomprehenſible; the Woman or wiſdom of the Fleſh is forbidden to ſpeak in the Church, that is of the things of God, for that which is fleſh is fleſh, and the natural man he knows not the things of God, they are fooliſhneſs to him, neither can he know them, becauſe they are ſpiritually diſcerned, 1 Cor.
• . 4. and ſo the carnal minded man he ſayth that a Woman (or the female kinde) ought not to ſpeak in the Church: now the firſt birth either in man or w • man hath nothing to do to ſpeak in the Church, (the carnal part) for it knows not the things of God, and every man by nature is a childe of wrath, and he is forbidden to ſpeak with his carnal wiſdom, which he gathe edout of Books and Studyes for that nature is adulterated from God, and nothing muſt ſpeak in the Church in God but the Holy Ghoſt, and that may ſpeak in the Temple, either in male or female; nothing muſt ſpeak in the Church, but the Spirit of Truth, whom the world and carnal minded ones know not. God is a Spirit, and they that know him, know him to be to and none know him but they that are ſpiritual, for ſayth Ieſu Chriſt Except ye be born again, ye cannot enter into the Kingdom, o • Heaven, Iohn 3. and that which is fleſh is fleſh, and that knoweth not the thing of God neither in male nor female, but is adul erated from God, but that which is ſpirit is ſpirit, and is born of God, either in male or female, that knoweth him and that is permitted to ſpeak in the Temple, an • none can call Ieſus Lord but by the Holy Ghoſt, 1 Cor. 12.3. and be manifestation of the Spirit is given to profit withall, Verſe 7. and the Spirit of the Lord was made manifeſt through the female kind • , as women • n • ormer ages, and it was profitable; for Deborah ſhe had the m • ni • e •• ation of the Spirit of God ruling in her, by which ſhe or the lord in her did adminiſter juſtice to the Iſrae • ite • , which were the Church and People of God, and ſhe was a Judg am • n • ſt them and judged Iſrael Iudges 4.4. and ſhe prophecyed to Bara • , that a • the River Kiſho •
the Lord would deliver Siſ • ra the Captain of I • bins Army in • o hi • h • nd; See the noble acts that the Lord did by the Prop • eteſs his ſervant Deborah, reade i • age •
4, 5 chapters and the Lord hath ſayd, he will pour out his Spirit upon al • fl • ſh a • d their ſons and daughtors ſhall prophecy, Ioel 2.2 • . • he doth not ſay that fleſh ſhall prophecy neither in ſon • nor daughters, that is forbidden; Let
all Fleſh be ſilent, both in Sons and Daughters, and let the Spirit ſpeak for that is permitted either in Son or Daughter: it is the Spirit that Propheſies and fore tels of the things of God, and the maniſtacion of the Spirit is given to profit withall, in a Daughter as well as in a Son, that God may ſpeak where he doth dwel in his Temple. Let all carnal Wiſdom in Male as well as in Female keep ſilence, for that is not permited to ſpeak, it is adulterated from God, and the natural man knowes not the things of God, and he that is joyned to an Harlot is one Body, 1 Cor. 6.16 and that muſt be judged and caſt out by the Spirit of Truth, and judgment being brought forth into Victory, let the Truth declare it ſelf, but let all Fleſh be ſilent till the Spirit be poured out eyther in Son or Daughter, for all the Wiſdom of the world it knoweth not God, who is a Spirit, and he chuſeth the weak things of this world to confound the things which are mighty, 1 Cor. 1.27.28.29. and the Woman is counted the weaker Veſſel, but the Lord filling that Veſſel full of his Wiſdom, and ruleing it by his holy Spirit he dwelling in his Temple, and declaring himſelf through it by his Son Ieſus Chriſt, it is for the Praiſe of the glory of his Grace, that no Fleſh might glory in his ſight, for that muſt be trodden under foot, fleſhly Wiſdom and carnal Reaſon, both in Male and Female, that the Lord may be all in all in the Creature, making them fit Temples for his holy Spirit to dwel in 1 Cor. 3.16. that he may ſpeak in his Temple, in the Female as well as the Male.

The Body it is but the Temple, it is the Man-childe Chriſt Ieſus, where he is born up into the underſtanding that is to declare the Fathers will and that is permited to ſpeak, the Spirit of Truth which the world cannot receive, Iohn 14.16.17.26. but not carnal wiſdom, and fleſhly imaginacions, which is out of Covenant with God, and muſt be burnt up by the Spirit of Truth, before the Temple be fitred and prepared for the Maſters uſe, for nothing muſt ſpeak in the Churh but the Spirit of the Living God, let all Fleſh keep Silence, that is not permited to ſpeak in any, and Paul he was made a Miniſter not by the will of man, but by the will of Cod, who revealed his Son in him, Gal. 1.8. and your Daughters ſhall Propheſie, Acts 2.17.18. And the ewas one man which had four Daugh ers which were Virgins, and
they did Propheſie Acts 21.8.9. and he ſaith, all may Propheſie one by one, that all may learn and all may be comforted, and the Spirits of the Prophets are ſubject to the Prophets, 1 Cor. 14.30.31. it is the Spirit that is to Propheſie, and tis the Spirit that is to ſpeak in the Church, and where the Spirit is made manifeſt it is profitable to others, and none can call Jeſus Lord, but by the holy-Ghoſt, and where he ſayth, Let your women keep ſilence in the Church, &c. for ſayth he, it is a ſhame for Women to ſpeak in the Church, but he doth not ſay, let the Spirit of God keep ſilence in the Temple, but that may declare where it is manifeſted, either in Male or Female and then it is the Man Chriſt that ſpeaks in them; for great is the Myſtery of Godlineſs, Chriſt in you the hope of Glory, Col. 1.27. and his ſheep they hear his Voice: If any men hath an Ear to hear let him hear what the Spirit ſayth; for ſayth the Lord by the holy-ghoſt, Let no man deceive you, for if any man among you, ſeem to be wiſe in this world, let him become a Fool that he may be made wiſe, for the Wiſdom of this World is fooliſhneſs with God, for it is written, he taketh the Wiſe in their own craftineſs, and the Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wiſe that they are vain, 1 Cor. 3.18.19.20. man by his carnal wiſdom is ſottiſh in the things of God, that he would compare ſpiritual things with carnalthings, becauſe his wiſdom and underſtanding is altogether carnal, to be carnally minded is Death, Rom 8.6. but the Holy-Ghoſt teacheth to compare ſpiritual things with ſpiritual things, becauſe they are ſpiritually diſcerned, and the natural man knowes them not, for they are fooliſhneſs unto him, 1 Cor. 2.11.12.13.14.

Now the Scriptures we e not ſpoke forth by the will of man nor by the carnal minde, and ſaln wiſdom, if they had the carnal minde could have underſtood them, but as they was ſpoken forth by the holy-Ghoſt which the carnal minde or faln wiſdom knowes not; thereſore the Scriptures are a Myſtery to the firſt nature in m n, and he reads but doth not underſtand, for the Life of them is hid from his carnal minde, and ſo he argues from them carnally; but he can deceive none now but blinde men & Fools like himſelf, ſora wiſe mans Eyes are in his Head, his Light is in C • riſt, and he ſeeth that the Scriptures need not an Orthodox Key, for Holy men of God as they were moved they ſpoke
them forth by the holy-ghoſt, 2 Pet. 1.19.20.21 and where that is made manifeſt again, it reads them plainly, but till then they read they know not what, as the worldly Wiſe-men and Sir Simons do now, that gets pea • king up into an high place, ſuch as the Pharyſies uſed, who were Enemies to Ieſus Christ then▪ a • they are now; and they are called of men Maſters as they were, and without Money will they do nothing: but now the Key of David is found again, and it turns about freely to unſold the Myſtery, that hath been hid, and revealeth the Myſtery both to Sons and Daughters according to the Premiſe of the Lord, ſo that the Woman Iezabel, that hath ſo long born Rule in the Synagogue of Satan where Simon Magus did • ule, that ſold the Letter for Money will not now be permitted to ſpeak in the Church but caſt out; for the Wiſdom of the Fleſh muſt not be ſuffered to uſurp authority over the Man-childe the Spirit of Truth, for he will rule and a • l DIVINERS will be MAD, Iſay 44.24.25. ſuch as yee proud Prieſts are, that ſell the Letter without the Spirit, and ſpeak Divinacions of their own Brains and not from the mouth of the Lord, and ſuch muſt now be •• opped and not permitted to ſpeak in the Church, nor of the things of God, by their ca • nal Wiſdom which is fooliſhneſs with God, and their ſtudied out Knowledg which is adulterated from God and leads them a whoring after their own invencions, forſaking the Fountain of living mercies, to delight in lying-vanities, but now they muſt c • m • under the Law, and be ſevere • y puniſhed, and their mouths will be ſtopped by the T ••• th, for it is written Thou ſhalt not muz • le the mouth of • he Ox that treadeth out the Corn; and will have Mercy and not Sacrifice, go to the School of Chriſt, to learn what that meaneth, and then you will know what the Apoſtle ſayth in that place of Scripture; whe • you are com • through the Fire, to have your own Works and Wiſdom, and ſtudied out Arts bu • ned, 1 Cor. 2 13.14.15.16. that you may know the ſame minde ruleing in the Temple that wa in Chriſt that nothing may be done through Strife or V • in glory, but in Lowline •• of m • nde each one eſteeming other better than themſel • es, and being, of one accord, and one minde, as they were that ſpoke ſorth the Scriptures, Phil. 2.1.2 3.4.5.6 to the 12. Then wil you know what is to be underſtood concerning the
womans non-permiſſion, but reade on in that place of 1 Cor. 14. and ſee the following Verſes, where he hath been ſpeaking of the woman, and he ſayth in the 36 Verſe, What, ſayth he, came the Word of God out from you, or came it unto you onely? for ſayth he, If any man think himſelf to be a Prophet, or ſpiritual, let him acknowledg that the things that I write unto you are the commands of the Lord; but if any man be ignorant, let him be ignorant, 1 Cor. 14.36, 37, 38. but he doth exhort to prophecy, and ſayth, forbid it not, but rather covet after it, and your Daughters they ſhall prophecy as well as Sons, and the Spirits manifeſtation is to profit withall; therefore forbid not to ſpeak with Tongues, the Tongue of the learned, ſuch as are taught of God, by the Spirit of Truth, the Holy Ghoſt which the world cannot receive and that is to ſpeak in the Temple, and in the Church for elſe Paul would not have commended Phebe to have been a Miniſter or Servant to the Church, Rom. 16.1. if he had forbidden the Spirit of Truth for being declared through women in the Church: but are ye not yet carnal, and it is carnality which is forbidden to intermingle with with Spirituality; for Paul writ to the Romans to receive Phebe, which was a Servant or Miniſter to the Church at Cenchrea, and not onely to receive her, but to receive her in the Lord, and to aſſiſt her in whatſoever buſineſs ſhe had need of, Rom. 16.2. and he writ to them alſo to greet Priſcilla and Aquila; and ſee what he ſayth more in 3, 4, 5. Verſes, and ſayth he, Greet Mary who beſtowed much labor on us, Rom. 16.6. and ſayth he, Salute Tryphena and Tryphoſa who labor in the Lord, and ſalu e Rufus choſen in the Lord and his mother and mine; and many are called but • ew choſen, as theſe, Rom. 16.13. Salute Tryplena and Tryphoſa, delicious or delicate, two godly women, and beloved of the Lord, who labo • red with Pau •
in the Goſpel▪ and Perſis a faithfull woman, who laboured much in the Lord with Pa • l in the Goſpe • , Rom. 6.2. Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his ſister, and Olympas and all the Saints that are with them, Salute one another with an holy • iſs, the C • urches of Chriſt ſalute you, Rom 16.15.16.

And again ſayth Paul to the Brethren Help thoſe women that labored with me in the Gospel, with Clement alſo, and with other my fellow laborers, whoſe names are in the Book of Life, Phil. 4.1, • , 3. Heer is not Women forbidden to ſpeak in the Church where the Spirit of Chriſt was manifeſt to rule, but they are ſaluted with an holy kiſs in the Lord, and women-laborers • n the Goſpel, and they are to be received in the Lord, and to be aſſiſted,
&c. But ſayth he, Mark them which cauſe diviſions and offences contrary to the Doctrine of Chriſt, which ye have learned, and avoid them, for they that are ſuch ſerve not our Lord Ieſus Chriſt, but their own belleys, as the Prieſts of the World do now in this generation, who by good words and fair ſpeeches deceive the hearts of the ſimple, Rom 16, 17, 18. Now ſuch as theſe that ſerve themſelves and their belleys▪ and ſeeks for great Benefits, and teach for Tythes, Bribes, Augmentations, Gifts and Rewards, as the Prieſts do, contrary to the practice of the Saints, and ſpeaks by their own wiſdom, and not from the mouth of the Lord, they cauſe diviſions and diſſentions, and they are to be marked, and to be caſt out, and not to ſpeak in the Church, nor of ſpiritual things, by their carnal Reaſon; therefore take counſel, and hold them not up, the Lord is againſt them.

But to Aquila and Priſcilla ſalute me, and to the Church that is in their houſe, 1 Cor. 16.19. and let her ſpeak by the Spirit of the Lord the things of God made manifeſt unto her, for it ſhe be not permitted to ſpeak in the Church and the Church be in her houſe, ſhe muſt not ſpeak, but go out of her hou e; but the Spirit of Truth is permitted to ſpeak in any where it is made manifeſt, the manifeſtation of the Spirit being given to profit withall, 1 Cor. 12. and every good gift, and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of Lights, with whom is no variableneſs, neither ſhadow of turning for of his own will begat he us with the Word of Truth, that we ſhould be a kinde of firſt fruits of his creatures, Iames 1.17, 18. that we may be to the prayſe of the glory of his grace, who calleth u • out of darkneſs into his marvellous light, and maketh us ſit together with Christ Ieſus in heavenly places, Epheſ. 2. • , 5, 6. To him alone be prayſe, honor, and glory, who is King of kings, and Lord of lords; therefore let God ariſe, and let his Enemyes be ſcattered abroad, for he will make his People a willing People now in the day of his power, to worſhip him in ſpirit, and to ſerve him both day and eke each hour. Amen.
Hall • l •• jah to the higheſt, the Lord God omnipotent reigneth▪ Let all that love the Lord, bleſs the Lord, prayſe him, and magnifie him • or ever.
